label: 食封
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Grants of taxable households (kako) made by the government to individual persons, who then received all the tribute in kind (chō ), commuted taxes (yō ), regular annual forced labor (edachi ), additional forced labor (zatsuyō, and half - later, all- the tax of rice on paddy fields (so) levied by the government on the people of these households and the sustenance rice fields (kubunden) they held. If the grants were made according to one's rank (kurai ), they were called rank households (ifu ); according to one's official post, then office households (shikifu ); and according to one's merit, i. e., because of some special service to the state, then merit households (kōru ).
